results.title: Violence is Violence
results.creator_credit: SKA TV, Campbell Manderson and Pip Starr
results.brief_description: A report on the concerns over the private toll road which was built at the expense of over 2 hectares of public parkland in inner Sydney. Hundreds of Sydney residents take over the streets to protest car-dominated public space and offer a vision of urban sustainability. Their celebration is met with a brutal police response. Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.

results.title: Colbo Nights
results.brief_description: Football practice, barbequed snags and a couple of beers at the pub. This is Thursday night in Colbinabbin and you can meet local characters such as Slab, Meathead and Stewballs. The atmosphere is one of a close knit community that loves sports, live music and supports each other through good times and bad.

results.title: Thugs of the Forest
results.creator_credit: SKA TV, Campbell Manderson and Pip Starr
results.brief_description: An expose of the attack on Goolengook protesters who were ambushed in the middle of the night by a group of angry foresters.Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994. WARNING : STRONG LANGUAGE - NOT suitable for General Audience

results.title: The Reserve
results.brief_description: This film shows what a group of passionate individuals can achieve to create a place for the whole town to enjoy. Volunteers and paid workers dedicated their time and energy to cleaning up Crown land in the middle of Nanneella. With assistance from the whole town and surrounding area the Nanneella Bushland Reserve is now used by the community for bonfires, social gatherings or just to sit and enjoy a picnic.

results.title: Corporate Globalisation
results.creator_credit: SKA TV, Campbell Manderson and Pip Starr
results.brief_description: A look at the negative effects of corporate globalization has on the environment and human rights laws. Screened as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Campaspe
results.brief_description: Nine stories about residents from around the Campaspe region in northern Victoria. Covering the towns of Nanneella, Gunbower and Colbinabbin, locals tell stories about their lives and their connection to the land and the community.

results.title: Pandamonium
results.creator_credit: Academy of Interactive Entertainment (AIE) and Daniel Riddle
results.brief_description: A bad tempered stuffed panda is plucked from the window display of a toy store by a sweet little girl. 3-D computer animation. Original score composed by Chris Lam Sam.

results.title: The Lunar cycle
results.creator_credit: Academy of Interactive Entertainment (AIE) and Kai Faigenbaum
results.brief_description:
A man on a unicycle travels above the sleeping city on a cloudy night, sweeping darkness away to reveal a new moon. This 3D animated fable offers a new interpretation of the term ‘lunar cycle’.
Music by Andy Statman.
